slides.title: Motion and Force
slides.content:
**Motion:**
- Change in position of an object
- **Speed:** How fast an object moves
- **Velocity:** Speed with direction

**Force:**
- Push or pull on an object
- **Unit:** Newton (N)
- **Examples:** Kicking a ball, pulling a rope

**Types of Force:**
- **Gravity:** Pulls objects towards Earth
- **Friction:** Opposes motion between surfaces
- **Magnetic Force:** Attraction or repulsion between magnets

**Newton's Laws (Simple):**
1. Object at rest stays at rest unless force is applied
2. Force = Mass Ã— Acceleration
3. Every action has equal and opposite reaction

**Example:**
- When you push a wall, wall pushes you back (Action-Reaction)

slides.title: Energy, Light and Sound
slides.content:
**Energy:**
- Ability to do work
- **Types:**
  - Kinetic Energy: Energy of moving objects
  - Potential Energy: Stored energy
  - Heat Energy: Energy from heat
  - Light Energy: Energy from light
  - Sound Energy: Energy from sound

**Light:**
- Travels in straight lines
- **Reflection:** Light bouncing back from surface
- **Mirrors:** Reflect light
  - Plane mirror: Shows exact image
  - Concave mirror: Used in torches, headlights
  - Convex mirror: Used in vehicles (rear view)

**Sound:**
- Produced by vibrations
- Cannot travel in vacuum (needs medium)
- Travels fastest in solids
- **Speed of sound in air:** ~340 m/s
- **Echo:** Reflection of sound

**Electricity:**
- Flow of electric charge
- **Conductors:** Allow electricity to pass (copper, iron)
- **Insulators:** Do not allow electricity (rubber, plastic)
- **Battery:** Source of electricity
- **Units:** Volt (V), Ampere (A), Watt (W)
